title: LONGVARBINARY handling
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {403=When binary SQL data is converted to character C data, each byte (8 bits) of source data is represented as two ASCII characters. These characters are the ASCII character representation of the number in its hexadecimal form. For example, a binary 00000001 is converted to "01" and a binary 11111111 is converted to "FF".}
textBeforeTable: When binary SQL data is converted to character C data, each byte (8 bits) of source data is represented as two ASCII characters. These characters are the ASCII character representation of the number in its hexadecimal form. For example, a binary 00000001 is converted to "01" and a binary 11111111 is converted to "FF". Enables handling of binary column data. ODBC SQL types affected are BINARY, VARBINARY, and LONGVARBINARY. int $mode ) resource $result_id , odbc_binmode ( bool Description odbc_binmode — Handling of binary column data (PHP 4, PHP 5) odbc_binmode Report a Bug Edit English Brazilian Portuguese Chinese (Simplified) French German Japanese Korean Romanian Russian Spanish Turkish Other Change language: ODBC Functions ODBC Abstraction Layers Database Extensions Function Reference PHP Manual « odbc_autocommit odbc_close_all » Focus search box
textAfterTable: If odbc_fetch_into() is used, passthru means that an empty string is returned for these columns. Parameters result_id The result identifier. If result_id is 0, the settings apply as default for new results. Note: Default for longreadlen is 4096 and mode defaults to ODBC_BINMODE_RETURN. Handling of binary long columns is also affected by odbc_longreadlen(). mode Possible values for mode are: ODBC_BINMODE_PASSTHRU: Passthru BINARY data ODBC_BINMODE_RETURN: Return as is ODBC_BINMODE_CONVERT: Convert to char and return Return Values Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on failure. add a note User Contributed Notes 4 notes up down 1 yhalmoe at yahoo dot no ¶ 5 years ago
